ETYMOLOGY: From Middle French excellent, from Latin excellens (stem excellent-), present participle of excellere ('to surpass', composed of ex- 'out' + cellere 'to rise, project').

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Adjective: A word modifying a noun.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Extremely good, superb; of the highest quality or merit.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 极好的；卓越的；杰出的；质量最高的。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The service we received at the hotel was excellent, exceeding all our expectations.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 我们在那家酒店得到服务非常出色，超出了我们所有的期望。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Interjection: An exclamation, especially one used to express emotion.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Used as an exclamation to express great pleasure, satisfaction, or strong approval.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 太棒了！好极了！（表示非常满意、赞同或高兴的感叹词）
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: "We secured the contract!" "Excellent! That's wonderful news."
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: “我们签下合同了！”“太棒了！这是个好消息。”
